letters.description: Gather comprehensive patient history, lifestyle data, and genetic predispositions to establish a clinical baseline.
Utilize advanced functional laboratory testing to identify physiological imbalances, nutrient deficiencies, and metabolic dysfunction.
Analyze clinical data to identify the upstream triggers, mediators, and antecedents of the patient’s health concerns.
Implement personalized protocols including clinical nutrition, therapeutic supplementation, and targeted lifestyle interventions.
Monitor progress and fine-tune the intervention plan based on patient feedback and follow-up diagnostic markers.
Provide the tools and education necessary for the patient to maintain systemic health and prevent future chronic dysfunction.
